intro: Senecio venosus, commonly known as the veiny groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and have prominent veins, giving it its common name. Senecio venosus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
